document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genera Anilaroides Théry, 1934, stat. nov. and Tetragonoschema Thomson, 1857 (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Buprestinae: Anthaxiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genera Anilaroides Théry, 1934, stat. nov. and Tetragonoschema Thomson, 1857 (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Buprestinae: Anthaxiini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anthaxia quadrata
Buquet, 1841 : 194
. Type locality: Haiti .

Tetragonoschema chrysomelina
Thomson, 1857 : 116
. Type locality: Haiti .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimen studied.
Number of syntypes unknown;
lectotype (
Fig. 24
), here designated (male, MNHN ): “Th. Type [p, black-framed] //
quadrata
Type Buqt.,
chrysomelina
Type Thoms., Haiti [h] // ex Museo James Thomson [p] // Type [p, red] // Museum Paris ex coll. R. Oberthur [p]”.

Diagnosis. Short, nearly as long as wide, black with an intense violet lustre; elytra 1.10 times as long as wide, lateral margins subparallel, posterior margins transversely truncate, dorsal surface asetose, pronotum very convex without lateroposterior depressions; aedeagus slender, slightly enlarged at basal third (
Fig. 70
). In its body-shape and colouration it is very similar to
T . ( T .) purpurascens
but stouter, and the frons has a deep, wide postclypeal impression; both species also differ from each other by the form of the elytra, pronotum and slightly in the shape of male metatibiae and genitalia (
Figs. 70
vs. 71 ).

Since the number of syntypes of
T. quadratum
is unknown I hereby designate the male from MNHN as the lectotype of
Anthaxia quadrata
Buquet, 1841
.

Note. According to
Théry ( 1944 )
Thomson obtained Buquet´s type and supposed it to be conspecific with
T . ( T .) chrysomelinum
: “Thomson, qui avait acquis le type de
T. quadrata Buq.
, a réuni lui-meme son
T. chrysomelinum
a cette espece”.
